intro: Gynoxys cygnata, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its vibrant orange to red ray flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its showy flowers bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Gynoxys cygnata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
